Detailed Description

Email object.

Create an email object with the required fields.

Member Function Documentation

- (id) initWithSubject: (NSString *)  _subject
andMessageBody: (NSString *)  _messageBody
isHtml: (BOOL)  _isHtml
andUrlsToBeShortened: (NSArray *)  _urls 

Returns a JREmailObject initialized with the given subject and message body.

Parameters:
_subject The desired subject of the email. The user can edit this value.
_messageBody The desired message body of the email. The message body can be in plain text or html, and if it is in html, this should be indicated by the argument isHtml. If you want to include urls that are shortened by to an http://rpx.me url, they should be added to the urls array, and the message body should contain the escape sequence @ where you want the urls to be substituted in. This value can be edited by the user.
_isHtml YES if the message body contains HTML content or NO if it contains plain text.
_urls The array of urls that JREngage will shorten to an http://rpx.me url, in the order you wish the urls to be substitued into the message body, replacing the sequence @ in the order that the @'s appear.
Returns:
A JREmailObject initialized with the given subject and message body.

Properties

- (NSString *) subject [read, write, retain]

The desired subject

- (NSString *) messageBody [read, write, retain]

The desired message body

- (BOOL) isHtml [read, write, assign]

Specify YES if the body parameter contains HTML content or specify NO if it contains plain text
